page.title: 05POSTLIP HALL - Pt.1
page.content: Postlip Hall,an Elizabethan gabled house, is now owned and occupied by a family commune. It was taken over on 1st July 1970.There are about 45 rooms with families living together sharing the work load and the expenses. The grounds cover 15 acres. They keep 17 sheep,34 chickens and 2 pigs. They are self-sufficient. When the Hall was bought for use as a commune, it cost 20000 needing a further 40000 to patch it up. The bulk of the house was built in 1614. There is a Norman Chapel belonging to the Catholic Church.Using a portable organ, a Service is held in it once a year. Members of the commune each have a house to themselves, the houses forming a courtyard. Families eat seperately but have a'common room' where they can get together and have a chat. (4)
